abstract: The Red Herring is reporting that Google has made another acquisition, this time agreeing to buy Adscape Media, which provides advertising within video games, for $23 million. The article seemed to question the move, however, suggesting that the purchase “gives Google little beyond a few potentially interesting patents,” and adding, “don’t expect the Internet giant to announce big in-game ad deals with publishers like Electronic Arts anytime soon.”
lead_paragraph: The Red Herring is reporting that Google has made another acquisition, this time agreeing to buy Adscape Media, which provides advertising within video games, for $23 million. The article seemed to question the move, however, suggesting that the purchase “gives Google little beyond a few potentially interesting patents,” and adding, “don’t expect the Internet giant to announce big in-game ad deals with publishers like Electronic Arts anytime soon.”

headline.main: Google Said to Buy Videogame Advertising Startup
